macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Equities Volatile Amid Cooler CPI and Mixed Earnings
items.summary: US indices showed early gains but ended lower with S&P 500 down 1.6%, Dow 1.3%, and Nasdaq 2.0% by February 13 due to flat retail sales, mixed earnings, and a cooler CPI at 2.4%. VIX rose to 20.60, indicating orderly hedging amid inflation and payroll data sensitivity.

items.title: Indian Markets Rally Led by Banking and Realty Sectors
items.summary: Nifty 50 rose 0.83% to 25,682.75 and Sensex up 0.79% to 83,277.15, driven by strong buying in realty, PSU banks, and pharma, while auto and metals faced pressure amid global macro uncertainty.

items.title: Australian ASX 200 Drops 1.39% Amid Sector Rotation
items.summary: S&P ASX 200 fell 125.90 points to 8,917.60 on Friday, with healthcare down 12.61% and IT off 5.37%, though weekly gains were 2.40% led by utilities and financials.

items.title: US Indices Flat to Slightly Up; VIX Eases to 20.60
items.summary: DJIA up 0.10% to 49,500.93, S&P 500 up 0.05% to 6,836.17, Nasdaq down 0.22%; VIX fell 1.06% amid soft CPI enthusiasm, with US 10-year yield at 4.06%.

items.title: Global Yields Lower and Commodities Mixed Post-CPI
items.summary: US 2-year yield below 3.41% lowest since 2022, Brent crude under $68, gold supported by softer yields; Bitcoin consolidates with selective ETF flows.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Falls 2.3% to $68,674 Amid Large Crypto Fund Outflows
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped 2.3% to $68,674 as crypto funds experienced $173 million in outflows last week, with the asset tracking toward its worst quarter since 2018, down 22.58% year-to-date. Concerns over quantum computing risks and a $6.9 billion liquidation event contributed to the selloff.

items.title: Analyst Warns Bitcoin Could Plunge to $10,000 as Crypto Bubble Implodes
items.summary: Analyst predicts an 85% Bitcoin collapse to $10,000 amid a crypto downturn erasing $2 trillion in market value, with $678 million in ETF outflows in February alone. AI disruption fears are hammering tech stocks and Bitcoin, though some institutions remain bullish.

items.title: Crypto Markets Slump After Disappointing US Jobs Report
items.summary: Crypto markets declined on February 16 following a brief rebound, with Bitcoin trading lower amid softer opening after last week's volatility. Ethereum fell 4.4% to $1,971 in the past 24 hours.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Top AI Stocks to Watch on February 16th
items.summary: MarketBeat highlights seven key artificial intelligence stocks to follow today: Upstart, Hut 8, Tempus AI, BigBear.ai, SoundHound AI, InterDigital, and Fermi, amid ongoing market interest in AI technologies.

items.title: One Year After AI Action Summit: Future Directions for Scientific AI
items.summary: Experts at a Paris event discuss AI's role in science one year post-AI Action Summit, emphasizing acceleration in molecular simulations, diffusion models for noisy data, and the need for accountable, reproducible AI methods ahead of the New Delhi summit.

items.title: AI Framework Summarizes Building Damage from Disaster Images
items.summary: University of California Berkeley researchers unveil LLM-DRS, a new AI system using large language models and vision tech to generate rapid structural health assessment reports from disaster reconnaissance images, aiding post-disaster response.

items.title: AI/ML in Practice: Assisted Active Learning Explored
items.summary: Emery Boston discusses assisted active learning (AAL) techniques in AI and machine learning applications, highlighting practical implementations in chromatography and related fields.

items.title: 2026 Global Strategy Briefing on Quantum and AI for Boards
items.summary: A guest post outlines latest AI developments including Moltbook, world models, agentic AI, and quantum AI intersections, alongside global policy on AI model exports and board upskilling recommendations.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: PlayStation's February 2026 State of Play Sets New Record with Massive Reveals
items.summary: PlayStation's recent State of Play event for February 2026 broke records by featuring numerous major game reveals and updates.

items.title: Nine Video Games Set for Release February 16-22, Including Styx: Blades of Greed
items.summary: This week's lineup features nine titles starting February 17 with NORSE: Oath of Blood, Under The Island, and Age of Empires II: DE – The Last Chieftains, culminating in the highly anticipated stealth-action sequel Styx: Blades of Greed on February 19.

items.title: First Break Labs Acquires and Relaunches Device Doctor Simulator on Steam Today
items.summary: First Break Labs has acquired publishing rights to Device Doctor Simulator 2024 and is relaunching it on Steam on February 16, 2026.

items.title: Unity CEO Claims AI Tech Will Soon Generate Full Casual Games from Prompts
items.summary: Unity's CEO Matt Bromberg states that their AI technology will soon enable non-coders to create complete casual games simply by prompting, eliminating the need for traditional coding.

items.title: NetEase Parts Ways with Western Studio Anchor Point Studios
items.summary: NetEase has separated from another internal Western studio, Anchor Point Studios, which was unveiled in April 2023, as it goes independent.

items.title: Five Overlooked New Steam Games Highlighted for February 16
items.summary: PC Gamer spotlights lesser-known recent Steam releases like Roadside Research, a co-op alien spy gas station sim, and others including Polyarmory: High Calibre Love.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Trapeze Rebrands European Operations into Four Transit Technology Brands
items.summary: Trapeze has rebranded its European public transport technology businesses into four dedicated brands—ebblo, Grampian Solutions, Naviquate, and Nexfeld—effective February 16, 2026, under Modaxo. These brands focus on advanced ITCS platforms, journey planning, ticketing, and real-time passenger information to enhance mobility innovation.

items.title: US Advances Nuclear Energy Deals in Central Europe for Security and Tech
items.summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced steps on February 15-16 in Slovakia and Hungary to build nuclear power plants using US technologies, including funding for a Westinghouse reactor FEED study in Slovakia and a new civil nuclear agreement with Hungary. The deals aim to boost energy security, industrial strength, and tech competitiveness, representing over $15 billion in US business opportunities.
